args: To think I would find men of the Empire\nin such a shameful, wretched state!
We recently received word that sylvans\nin the Halidom have staged a coup.
And yet you cravens would sit here\nand let this golden chance slip through\nyour fingers? Disgusting, all of you!
B-but we're deathly ill...\nThere's nothing to be done...

Silence! As of this moment, I am taking
command of this unit. You will return to
the capital and face punishment for
allowing our troops to be annihilated.

All men who are of courage, follow me!
Leave the rest for the wolves and ravens!
We will storm that loathsome, treacherous
prince's castle and take it for our own!
Uh, Luca? There's a lot of them.\nLike, a LOT a lot.
Looks like they got some healthy\nreinforcements. This might be more\ntrouble than I first thought.
SWEET MOTHER OF MERCY,\nTHERE'S SO MANY OF THEM!
And only us sylvans stand between\nthem and utter annihilation.
We have to do this, or there was no point\nin chasing {player_name} out!
Are these pathetic nature lovers really\nall that's protecting the Halidom?\nWhat a stroke of luck!
Crush the sylvans! Leave none alive!
Ah, what a valiant cry! I'm sure those\nsylvans are quaking in their very—
S-sir, that's not us! It's the enemy!
Behind us, sir! The New Alberians!\nIt's an ambush!
But I heard there was a sylvan revolt—\nand a grave illness besides!
That's what I heard too, but... Gyaaaaaa!
Sorry, pal, but ya heard wrong.\nWe're tip-top and ready to rock!
The sylvans didn't revolt—they brokered\na deal to protect us from the sickness.
This plan also had the advantage of luring\nsome over-confident imperial commander\ninto a trap of our own devising.
C'mon, everyone! This is our chance!
Right then! A toast to victory!
This is thanks to your quick thinking,\nLuca. We are in your debt—all of us.
Whoa, what's up with the formalities?\nYou know I'd do whatever it takes to\nsee my friends safe.
True—but if you didn't force us out of the\nHalidom, who knows what we'd be going\nthrough right about now?
It was a real humdinger of an idea.\nFrankly, I'm surprised it came outta\nyer noggin! ...Er, no offense.
Well, since the approaching soldiers were\nalso getting sick, I figured the cause had\nto be somewhere in the Halidom.
Which was true, because we all\nhealed up quick once we left.
Still, I am unclear as to why your plan\nrequired the pretense of false mutiny.
Would it not have been easier to\ntell us your reasoning rather than\nengage in such dissembling?
Yeah, but see, I didn't KNOW anything.\nIt was all guesswork. ...Plus, you never\nwoulda left if I just asked real nicely.
Not like it took long for folks to\nfigure out I was lyin', anyway.
Well, I certainly believed you at first.\nYou had such a serious look in your eyes!
Luca is correct. Had he not taken this\naction, I'm certain everyone would have\nhesitated if told to abandon the castle.
So here's to you, Luca—and all\nthe rest of the sylvans!
And yet, we cannot celebrate for long;\nwe still need to find and eradicate\nthe source of this disease.
Oh, that? Don't worry about it.\nI already figured it out.
Oh yeah—and I'm gonna take care of it.\nEveryone come back to the Halidom in,\nlike, three days. Okay?
What was that illness, anyway?\nAnd what is it you're planning\non doing, Luca?
...Actually, I think I'm gonna keep quiet\nabout it for now!
I am not certain this is the kind of thing\nwhere surprises should be included.
Elly's right. Plus, if you tell us the cause,\nwe might be able to do something about it.
And let you take all the credit?\nFat chance, bud!
I ain't sure whether to hug this guy\nor kill him where he stands...
And here we thought you were all\ngrown-up. You'll never change, man!
Sh-shut up! Besides, what's it matter?
Still, I don't know how I'm going to\nbreak this to the rest of the sylvans.
I mean, who'da thunk the álfr tree\nwould go and make everyone sick?
Guess we don't have a choice...
All right. Let's do this thing.
Sarisse? Guys? What're you doin' here?
We thought you were acting weird,\nso we followed you.
Wait, you ALL followed me here?\nMan, something must really be wrong\nwith me if I didn't notice a whole pack.
There IS something wrong with you, Luca.\nDo you know what you're trying to do?
Yeah. I'm gonna cut down the álfr tree.
And THEN what, genius?! Do you have any\nidea how the other sylvans will respond?!
They'll stop acknowledging you as sylvan.\nYou'll be an outcast. Banished. Alone.\nForbidden to visit even your own home.
Are you seriously okay with that?
That's WHY I'm doing it—\nso no one else has to.
So you'll be the one to shoulder all the\nblame?
It's nothing cool and admirable like that.\n...It's just, I made a promise.
I'm going to make a home for EVERYONE.
And that promise is worth your entire life\nand heritage?
Mascula didn't hesitate when he\nlearned what mattered, and I ain't\ngonna do it either.
So yeah, Sarisse. I'll give all that up.
Rrrr! You are SUCH an idiot sometimes!
I always wanted the barriers\nbetween races to go away.
But I feel like I won't make any progress\nso long as I keep calling myself a sylvan.
So I'm going to stop thinking\nof myself like one!
At the end of the day, I'm the same as\neveryone else that lives in this world.
And that means my race is the\nentire planet! I'm a planetian!
Only you could make that up, Luca.
Especially since it sounds kinda dumb.
Oh, we know. ...So should we\nget started or what?
Cutting down the álfr tree, obviously.
Er, didn't you come to stop me?
That was the plan when we thought you\nwere doing some crazy, half-baked idea.
But then you told us you were going to\ngive up your sylvan heritage.
So I'm going to join you.
And I suppose we can't have Luca being a\nplanetian while his sis is still sylvan.
Guys, are you sure about this?
Not getting cold feet, are you?
No—I just didn't expect all of you\nto be such idiots!
Hello, pot. It's kettle. Nice to meetcha!\nAnyway, enough snark. We've got some\nwork to do—right, Luca?
Yep! I'm going to make a home where\neveryone can finally live in peace.
And I'll cross any barrier and break\nany rule to see that happen!
So hold on, Mascula! I'm coming!
